msbt.message: Question for you, kiddo. You got a sweet tooth?Me, I don't like sweet things. Except apple cider vinegar. Gahaha!

Anyway, I got these macaroons from my neighbor the other day.I was gonna feed 'em to a goat or somethin', but I took a tiny bite and the darn things are delicious! Guess it goes to show you You gotta take a bite outta life sometimes! !

Anyway, the other day an old friend of mine invited me out to eat somethin' called a "par-fay." It was so cold it made my brain hurt.<10_4 /> I loved it!Let that be a lesson, kiddo. You gotta rattle your brain with new foods every now and again. Gahaha!

Anyway, the other day I spilled some cinnamon and sugar on my regular dry toast. I was so mad! But then I gave it a try, and wouldn't you know? It tasted better than usual. ! I guess that's my way of sayin'try new things, kiddo. It helps keep you young. See how well it's workin' on me? Gahaha!
Alright, kiddo. Just answer, don't think about it. Rainy, sunny, or cloudy day. Pick one!
Sunny day.
Rainy day.
Cloudy day.

Aha! I've got great news for you. I've got this weird superpowerIf the last thing you think of before you go to sleep is me, then you'll wake up to a sunny day! Must be on account of my sunny disposition, eh? Gahaha!

Ahh, look at you! Not everyone appreciates a rainy day, but they should. ! From the sound to the smell, there's just somethin' about the rain that soothes the soul. Yessireeit takes someone of character to find joy in a drizzly day, and I knew you'd be one of 'em.

Whoa, you actually like cloudy days, and I can see you're tellin' the truth! Well, more power to you. You give an answer like that and I can tell you're gonna be straight with me. I'm glad there are still a few folks in this world who don't mind a little gray. Gahaha!
Alright. Listen up, kiddo. I'm gonna learn you an important lesson.<10_4 /> Convenience is overrated!

Lemme explain. Take your basic calculator. It makes things too easy!Kids these days can't even add two numbers in their head. They gotta look it up on a phone! Go on, ask me what 25 plus 17 is.<10_4 /> It's 48! Didn't even need to think about it. Kids these days

Like this whole email thingy. Oh, goodie, you can send a picture of a smiley face through the ethernet! In my day, if you wanted to talk to someone, you had to walk over to their house and shout at them! Or you could always write an angry letter and tape it to their buggy when they weren't lookin' Whaddaya mean, how old am I?

Like paper towels, for instance. They're made outta trees!If you spill some milk and you wipe it up with a paper towel, it's like you're cleanin' up a cow with a tree! Wait, what were we talkin' about again?
Hey there, kiddo. You heard about this?

Oysters are amazin'! They say each one has a great big servin' of brain enhancers. That's what I call 'em, anyways. There's probably some fancier word, like "vitamin C" or "mercury." Whaddaya mean, where'd I go to medical school?!
Honey lasts forever! <10_4 />No foolin'. They got honey from back when the pyramids were built that's still fresh! Me, I wouldn't touch a drop of the stuff, though. The only sweet I like is !

The syrup that they put on snow cones all tastes the same! They've been lyin' to you with those colors! Trust me. The cherry may be red and the blueberry may be blue, but they all taste like banana. Unrelated, the doc says I gotta get my sense of taste checked out one of these days
I got a question about computers for you, kiddo. Have you ever used one before? Bah, that's probably a dumb question. Of course you have!Me, though, I just used my first computer the other day

I was at my pal's house, and he told me to boot up the computer.So I get ready to drop-kick the thing and he looks at me funny.He starts talkin' about the hard drive and I'm like, "Buddy, I walked here!"

I was at my pal's house, and he says, "Now, click the mouse." And I was likewhat mouse?! He points to this little thingy next to the computer, so I mashed it with my hand. It went click alright! Then the screen went black and my friend said, "Good job!" But I think maybe he was bein' sarcastic.

I was at my pal's house, and he's talkin' all kinds of gibberish about draggin' and droppin' and whatnot. So I dragged the durn thing outside with me and dropped it in the recyclin' bin! He was real happy about that. Gahaha!

Hey, kiddo, reckon I know just what needs right now<10_4 /> Someone inspirin'! And you wanna know what that certain someone might look like? Like yours truly, !I bet if you talked up my good ideas to everyone on this island, they'd start gettin' inspired right away!

In case you heard the story goin' around that I unearthed an amazin' buried treasure, The truth is that I managed to dig up some old marbles from when I was just a little kiddo, .Funny how my bein' excited about findin' some old toys got turned into a tall tale of forgotten treasure.
You got a friend who's, like, that ONE friend? The one who all the stories are about? 'Cause I sure do

So this guy was listenin' to music on his phone. REAL loud. Outside, in public, y'see.And all of a sudden, he's like, where's my phone?! I need my phone, guys!All the while, he's HOLDIN' his phone in his hand! Then he reaches in his pocket and pulls out another phone!Guess that was the phone he was lookin' for. Anyway, we're not on speakin' terms anymore. Ironic, huh?

He's got one o' them "smart watches," you know? The ones that think they're smarter'n you?So he says, "Watch this," and then he starts pressin' the screen left and right and up and down.But nothing's happenin'! Except for his face gettin' redder and redder.Gahaha! The day I let a watch outsmart me is the day I retire.My toaster, thoughthat thing's got a mind of its own

She's a twin. Looked just like her twin sister, except they had different colored hair.Well, you know how twins love pullin' pranks, so one time they switched hair color to fool everyone.Even went to each other's jobs! Thing is, one of 'em was my doctor, and the other was a race-car driver.I still got a prescription, mind ya. Two hours of driftin' and a routine oil change. Cleared me right up!
How're you enjoyin' that NookPhone Tom Nook gave you, kiddo?

Just the other day, I was punchin' buttons on it and wound up in some kind of camera doodad.I was tryin' to figure out how to close it when suddenly everything started lookin' like an antique photo!Let me tell ya, that took me back. Believe it or not, the whole world looked like that when I was young!It's true!<10_4 /> Or at least I remember it being true, and that's good enough for me, ! Gahaha!

Mine started beeping at me almost the moment I got it, and nothing I did could make it stop.Well, I finally figured it out. Turned out I had a pile of them Nook Mile whatchamacallits waitin' for me!Ain't nothing more satisfying than watchin' that little number go up.Now, if only I knew what this miles business was all about
I don't see why they felt the need to stick a map on it. This island ain't THAT big, !So what if I got myself turned around and lost for four hours? That's all just part of the adventure, I say!
The march of technology sure is somethin', ain't it?

Why, now I'm finding out there are fridges that'll prep your meals for you. And some will even talk to you!I never thought I'd see the day a refrigerator could be friendly. We've come a long way from root cellars.

Have you seen the TVs they have now? They're half as thin as a piece of paper. And the picture? Wow!The images are so lifelike it's like you can reach in and become a part of what you're watchin'!Don't actually reach in though. For all their bells and whistles, new TVs scratch just as easy as old ones

For instance, now there are robots that'll vacuum your place for ya.But what, I ask, happens if you have a dirt floor? We don't all have fancy- schmancy carpets or hardwood.The robot's job is to vacuum all the dirt, right? So on a dirt floor, does it just keep goin' until it hits magma?Sometimes I wonder if all those technologists have got their heads on straight,
